sentences: The process for finalizing the rules and operational details of the Protocol was agreed at COP 4 in 1998 in a document known as the Buenos Aires Plan of Action (BAPA).
The BAPA set COP 6 as the deadline for finalizing these details and strengthening implementation of the UNFCCC .
In November 2000, parties met at COP 6 in The Hague, the Netherlands, to complete these negotiations.
They were not successful, and COP 6 was suspended until July 2001 when it reconvened in Bonn, Germany.
After further talks, parties adopted the Bonn Agreements, a decision that provided high-level political direction on the implementation of the Kyoto Protocol.
But delegates were still unable to finalize text on some issues, and agreed to forward all the draft decisions to COP 7 for final resolution.
enb_long_title: Vienna Climate Change Talks 2007 - AWG 4 and the Dialogue 4
